intro: Anagallis acuminata, commonly known as the mouse-ear or pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, often at dusk. Its flowers have five petals and are pollinated primarily by insects, particularly bees and moths. Anagallis acuminata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in gardens or wildflower meadows.
